group_1.narration: They say that love is blind,@but it seems I truly lost sight of my surroundings at the time.@Perhaps I got carried away@because it was my first love.
No matter what the circumstances were,@I couldn't contain my overflowing affection.
The effects of this were obvious during@independent practice, club activities, and even@during Teacher's math class...

group_1.textCenter: Okay, so who can tell me the answer to@this problem?

group_1.textLeft: Here, here! Over here!@Teacher! Over here!

group_1.textRight: Well then, alright... Kurusu.
...What's the matter?@Answer quickly...

group_1.textLeft: P-pardon me, I was just so happy...

group_1.textRight: Happy...?
But you haven't even given the correct answer@yet...?

group_1.textLeft: I'm just happy that you picked me...!

group_1.textRight: I just picked normally...@Hurry up and answer.
...Correct. You've done a good job@reviewing the material...

group_1.textLeft: (Because just remembering the conversations we've@had before going to bed makes for a good review!)
(...is what I want to say, but that's@certainly not a wise idea...!)

group_1.textRight: I know you're happy you got the right answer,@so sit down already.
You're really amazing, Sasha.
I mean, you talk to the math teacher@so cheerfully like that...
I'm a little scared of that teacher...@So I'm amazed...
That's right! I'd never be able to do that!
I mean, I got so scared just seeing you@talking to him.
I thought he was gonna get suuuper mad@at you.

group_1.textLeft: Ah... Perhaps it's because he's also my club advisor?

group_1.textRight: No, I've heard he's got a reputation for@being scary in the club too.
I wonder if he's even capable of smiling...

group_1.textCenter: (Even though he actually makes@so many different expressions...)
(Even though he's so sweet that he'll even@put up with my jokes...!)
(I'll just have to do my best to build up@his reputation...)
(I suppose I should start with@an awareness survey.)

group_1.textRight: Huh? The math teacher?@He's kinda scary.
I can never tell what he's feeling...or rather,@I don't know if he feels anything in the first place.
He's the high school section's...@Vocal Music Club advisor, right?
He's kind of unapproachable...

group_1.textLeft: Teacher...you're not very popular...@In fact, everyone's very afraid of you...

group_1.textRight: I see... Well, it doesn't really matter...
I don't think teachers need to be popular...
Some might say teachers should@get close to their students, but...
I'm not really cut out for that sort of thing...

group_1.textLeft: Not cut out for it...? Could it be that you're@bad with children...or something like that?

group_1.textRight: I'm not bad with kids, but I'm not really good@with them either.
I've always preferred to be alone...

group_1.textLeft: Well... Then why did you become a teacher?

group_1.textRight: Because...both of my parents were teachers...@I guess.
It's been a natural career path for me to follow@ever since I was a kid.
I wouldn't go that far.
I just couldn't tell them that I wanted to be@a singer instead.
I wouldn't exactly say it was my dream,@so I shouldn't regret it, but...
Just...sometimes I wonder if there's any meaning@to this life.
Heh, I sounded like a middle schooler.

group_1.narration: This time,@Teacher's smiling face@didn't make my heart throb...
Knowing that he didn't want to be a teacher...@and that he regrets his life...@I felt nothing but sorrow...
I want Teacher to feel happy about being Teacher.@That's why I made my move...
